markdown:
Meladaemons personify death by starvation and thirst, and revel in spreading the same despair that brought about their mortal demise. When they aren't blighting fields, massacring livestock, or tainting water supplies, they experiment on prisoners to study how long creatures can go without sustenance and the deleterious effects that result from such deprivation. Fiercely loyal to Trelmarixian, Horseman of Famine, they serve no other beings. They work alongside other daemons if Trelmarixian wills it, but are notoriously traitorous. **[Recall Knowledge - Fiend](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Religion](/Skills.aspx?ID=13)): DC 28 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 26 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 23 [Meladaemon](/Monsters.aspx?ID=593) **Source** [Bestiary 2](/Sources.aspx?ID=32) pg. 58 2.0 **Perception** +21; [darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=12), [lifesense (imprecise) 30 feet](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=21) **Languages** [Common](/Languages.aspx?ID=1), [Daemonic](/Languages.aspx?ID=31); [telepathy 100 feet](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=37) **Skills** [Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=1) +20, [Deception](/Skills.aspx?ID=5) +23, [Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=7) +23, [Religion](/Skills.aspx?ID=13) +20, [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=15) +23, [Survival](/Skills.aspx?ID=16) +19 **Str** +7 **Dex** +5 **Con** +6 **Int** +3 **Wis** +4 **Cha** +6 --- **AC** 31 **Fort** +23 **Ref** +20 **Will** +19 +1 status to all saves vs. magic **HP** 225 **Immunities** [death](/Traits.aspx?ID=40) effects **Weaknesses** good 10 **Consumptive Aura** ([aura](/Traits.aspx?ID=206), [divine](/Traits.aspx?ID=48)) 20 feet. A meladaemon emanates an aura of intense hunger. Each round a creature begins its turn in the aura, it must attempt a DC 27 Fortitude save. On a failure, the creature takes 1d6 negative damage (2d6 on a critical failure) and becomes [fatigued](/Conditions.aspx?ID=15). This fatigue ends as soon as the creature eats any food.
**Withering Opportunity** **Trigger** The meladaemon is attacked by an adjacent creature and the attack misses; **Effect** The meladaemon swipes at the triggering creature, which must immediately attempt a save against the meladaemon's withering touch. --- **Speed** 25 feet, fly 50 feet **Melee** bite +24 ([Evil](/Traits.aspx?ID=64), [Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [reach 10 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192)), **Damage** 2d12+13 plus 1d6 evil and daemonic famine **Melee** claw +24 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [Evil](/Traits.aspx?ID=64), [Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [reach 10 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192)), **Damage** 2d8+13 slashing plus 1d6 evil, [Grab](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=18), and withering touch **Divine Innate Spells** DC 31 - **1st** [Detect Alignment](/Spells.aspx?ID=65) (good only; at will) - **4th** [Dimension Door](/Spells.aspx?ID=69) (at will) - **5th** [Dimension Door](/Spells.aspx?ID=69), [Fear](/Spells.aspx?ID=110), [Magic Missile](/Spells.aspx?ID=180) (at will) - **6th** [Phantom Pain](/Spells.aspx?ID=220) **Rituals** DC 31 - **4th** [Blight](/Rituals.aspx?ID=4) **Daemonic Famine** ([Disease](/Traits.aspx?ID=46)) **Saving Throw** DC 29 Fortitude; **Stage 1** carrier (1 day); **Stage 2** [enfeebled 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=13) (1 day); **Stage 3** enfeebled 2 (1 day); **Stage 4** as stage 3; **Stage 5** enfeebled 3 (1 week); **Stage 6** dead **Withering Touch** ([Divine](/Traits.aspx?ID=48), [Evil](/Traits.aspx?ID=64), [Necromancy](/Traits.aspx?ID=117)) When the meladaemon hits with a claw Strike or a creature begins its turn grabbed by the meladaemon, the creature must attempt a DC 30 Fortitude save. On a failure, the creature takes 1d6 negative damage and becomes [fatigued](/Conditions.aspx?ID=15). This fatigue ends when the creature drinks.
Formed in his Image Meladaemons have always been gaunt and bestial, but they didn't always resemble jackals. When [Trelmarixian](/Deities.aspx?ID=137) overthrew the previous Horseman of Famine, one of his first acts as a ruler of Abaddon was to forcibly twist the appearance of his deacon caste to resemble his own wicked form. He went on to imbue meladaemons with other jackal-like aspects as it suited him, further warping them and cementing their fealty.
